creator: yw119232@iplanet.com
text:
In my Solaris 8, I created a counter with ref name R3 and checked Track Counter
Independently for each User option. In my sampler fields I use  ${R3} to
generate dynamic value for the HTTP request. But it keeps sending ${R3} instead
of the numbers that counter should do.

creator: jkb@stian.freeserve.co.uk
text:
This is really a documentation bug: 

the TRUE/FALSE parameter determines whether the function return is per-thread 
or not - it has no effect on the value saved in a variable.

If a variable name is supplied (e.g. R3), it is actually used as a PREFIX to 
create the actual variable names, which are then R£_TRUE and R3_FALSE.

If X is not defined as a variable, then ${X} will be left as it is.

creator: kurowski@symphoniq.com
text:
I believe jkb has misunderstood the reporter of the bug.  The reporter was NOT 
talking about the built-in __counter function.  He was talking about the 
Counter Pre-Processor, as evidenced by reference to the checkbox for "Track 
counter independently for each user".

The documentation section 13.7.3 HTML Parameter Mask is marked as deprecated, 
and the user is told to use Counter instead (section 13.7.6).  When I use 
Counter (on both solaris and windows), sometimes I get the same problem 
reported in this bug (the "*{RefName}" gets sent as text rather than being 
coverted to an integer), but sometimes it works for a while and then fails.  
This happens whether or not I check the checkbox.  I have not been able to 
isolate the problem, but I would certainly appreciate it if someone out there 
would try to reproduce it and fix it, given that I'd bet a lot of money that 
the bug affects more than just two of us.  :-(

Thanks!
